sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad mngon par 'tshang rgya ba yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom mo/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rtogs pa'i ye shes chen po la mkhas pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom mo// sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rab tu dbye ba bstan pa dang / sgrub pa rab tu bstan pa'i rgyus yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom ste/

“What is great enlightening beings’ practice of indomitability? Here the enlightening beings cultivate various forms of energy—foremost energy, great energy, excellent energy, outstanding energy, supreme energy, sublime energy, exalted energy, unsurpassed energy, unequalled energy, comprehensive energy. They become naturally free from the three poisons of greed, hatred, and delusion, naturally free from pride and conceit, naturally not hypocritical, naturally not stingy or jealous, naturally not deceitful, naturally conscientious. Ultimately they do not make any effort that would afflict a single living being. They only make efforts to cut off all afflictions, to pull out the roots of all confusion, to get rid of all force of habit, to know all realms of living beings, to know where all beings die and are born, to know the afflictions of all sentient beings, to know the inclinations of all sentient beings, to know the perspectives of all sentient beings, to know the superiority and inferiority of faculties of all sentient beings, to know the mental activities of all sentient beings, to know all realms of phenomena, to know the basic nature of all Buddha qualities, to know the equal nature of all Buddha qualities, to know the equal nature of all time frames, to attain the light of knowledge of all Buddha-teachings, to experience the knowledge of all Buddha-teachings, to know the unique true character of all Buddha-teachings, to know the infinity of all Buddha-teachings, to attain far-reaching decisive knowledge of techniques of all Buddha-teachings, and to attain the knowledge to analyze and expound the expressions and meanings of all Buddha-teachings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni/ de lta bu'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin no/ / de gal te 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du sems can re re'i phyir yang bskal pa grangs med par mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen por sdug bsngal du 'dug par yang spro zhing mos te/ sems can de dag kyang de tsam gyi bar gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar gyur la/ de'i dus su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das grangs med pa zhig byung ste/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag sus mthong ba de dag thams cad kyang bde ba'i yo byad kun dang ldan par gyur kyang byang chub sems dpa' de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya zhing / byang chub sems dpa' de ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med par gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi phyir sems can re re'i don du yang bskal pa grangs med par sems can dmyal ba chen po na de snyed kyi sems can yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du 'dug par spro ste/ de la la zhig gis 'di skad du/ rgya mtsho chen po grangs med pa skra'i rtse mos gzhal te 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa rdul du blags te bgrang ba de snyed kyi sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang sems skad cig tu yang mi 'bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa de lta bu dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur ro/ / zhes zer na yang /
kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / byang chub sems dpa' ni/ de la de'i phyir sems bskyed pa 'ga' tsam yang 'gyod pa dang ldan pa mi 'byung gi /de ni/ 'di snyam ste/ de ltar bdag gi mthus sems can 'di dag sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa de lta bu las yongs su grol bar gyur pa ni/ bdag gis thob pa legs par thob pa/ gal te thabs 'di 'dra bas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur na yang byang chub sems dpas sbyor ba de la spro bar bya ba yin no/ / zhes te/ de bas kyang ches dga' ba dang / spro ba skye'o/ /

Once enlightening beings have perfected these practices of energetic effort, if someone should say to them, ‘Can you pass countless eons enduring the pains of uninterrupted hell for the sake of each and every being in countless worlds, cause those beings to each meet countless Buddhas in the world, and through seeing Buddhas attain felicity and finally enter extinction without remainder, after which you yourself attain unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment?’ They would answer I can. Then again if someone should say, ‘There are countless oceans—you should drain them drop by drop with a hairtip; there are countless worlds—you should shatter them to atoms, and count each and every drop of the oceans and atoms of the worlds, and for that number of eons endure incessant suffering for the sake of living beings,’ the enlightening beings would not have a moment of regret or resentment on hearing such words—they would only be more joyful, feeling profoundly happy and fortunate that they had attained such a great benefit that they could by their power enable sentient beings to be forever liberated from suffering. Enlightening beings, by these means which they employ, enable all beings in all worlds to eventually reach ultimate release without remainder.
kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bzhi pa ste/ mi zad pa zhes bya ba'o/ /
“This is called the enlightening beings’ practice of indomitability.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa lnga pa rmongs pa med pa zhes bya ba gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dran pa dang ldan pa yin te/ dran pa'i dam pa 'khrug pa med pa/ rnam par 'khrug pa med pa/ brtan pa/ sra ba/ mi shigs pa/ zil gyis mi non pa/ yongs su dag pa/ che ba/ tshad med pa/ rmongs pa med pa dang ldan pa yin te/ dran pa des 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa rnams kyang yongs su 'dzin pa yin/ 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshig kyang yongs su 'dzin pa yin/ gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i tshig kyang yongs su 'dzin pa yin/ gzugs kyi rang bzhin la btags pa'i tshig kyang yongs su 'dzin pa yin te/ tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la btags pa'i tshig kyang yongs su 'dzin pa yin/ rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir tshig kyang yongs su 'dzin pa yin te/ de 'jig rten 'di nas kyang rmongs pa med par shi 'pho'o/ / 'jig rten pha rol tu yang rmongs pa med par skye ste/ ma'i mngal du yang rmongs pa med par 'gro/ ma'i mngal nas kyang rmongs pa med par 'byung ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa rmongs pa med pas gnas so; ; rmongs pa med par dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams mgu bar byed do/ / rmongs pa med par sangs rgyas kyi chos la mos par byed do/ / rmongs pa med par bdud kyi las rnams rab tu shes so/ / rmongs pa med par bdud kyi las rnams spong bar byed do/ / rmongs pa med par bskal pa brjod du med par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas so/ / de dran pa yongs su dag pa'i yan lag tshad med pa dang ldan pa yin te/ des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'am/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams las bskal pa grangs med pa na chos thos par gyur pa/ zab mo zab mor snang ba'am/ yangs pa'i chos rgyan rnam par phye ba'am; chos sna tshogs tshig dang yi ge sna tshogs kyis bstan pa'am/ byang chub sems dpa'i rgyan gyi chos sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs snang ba can nam/ bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos lhag pa'i bsam pa dge ba dang / mos pas rnam par dag pa'am/ 'jig rten thams cad la mi gnas pa'i chos 'jig rten gyis khong du chud pa dang mthun pa'am/ chos yangs pa rgya chen po'i chos su bstan pa'am/ rab rib dang bral ba'i chos 'jig rten gyis shes par bya ba'am/ 'jig rten thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi rjes su song ba'am; bla na med pa'i chos thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos kyis rgya cher rnam par 'phrul ba bstan pa

“What is great enlightening beings’ practice of nonconfusion? Here enlightening beings perfect right mindfulness, their minds free from distraction and disturbance, firm and imperturbable, consummately pure, immeasurably vast, without any delusion or confusion. By virtue of this right mindfulness they well understand all worldly speech and are able to remember the verbal explanations of transmundane laws. That is to say, they can remember the explanations of material and immaterial phenomena; they can remember the explanations of the definition of the intrinsic nature of sensation, perception, conditioning, and consciousness, without any confusion in their minds. In the world they die in one place and are born in another without confusion in their minds. They enter the womb and leave the womb without confusion in their minds. They arouse the will for enlightenment without confusion in their minds. They attend teachers without confusion in their minds. They earnestly practice the Buddhas’ teachings without confusion in their minds. They notice the doings of demons without confusion in their minds. They divorce demonic activity without confusion in their minds. They cultivate enlightening practice for countless eons without confusion in their minds. The enlightening beings, having developed this immeasurable right mindfulness, spend countless eons listening to truthful teachings from enlightened and enlightening guides—profound teachings relating to emptiness, vast teachings relating to activity in the relative world, teachings relating to adornment by virtuous qualities, teachings of all kinds of arrays of the qualities of the cosmos, all interrelated, teachings expounding various bodies of words, phrases, and sentences, teachings of the embellishments of enlightening beings, teachings of the supremacy of the spiritual power and radiance of the Buddhas, teachings of the purity of correct seeking of certain understanding, teachings of nonattachment to any world, teachings which define all worlds, teachings of extremely broad scope, teachings of removing the blinders of ignorance and understanding all beings, teachings of what is common and what is not, teachings of the excellence of enlightening knowledge, teachings of the independence of omniscience.

de lta bu dag thos kyang bskal pa grangs med pas brjed par mi 'gyur/ nyams par mi 'gyur/ rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ro/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe sems can su la yang dran pa rnam par 'khrug par mi byed/ chos rig pa thogs par mi byed/ dge ba'i rtsa ba'i blo gros 'jig par mi byed/ gzhan gyi blo la gnod par mi byed do/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la 'di lta bu'i sgra chen po mtho ba dag dang phrad par gyur te; drag po'i sgra dang / mi bzad par bos pa'i sgra dang / skyi g.ya' ba'i sgra dang / yid du 'ong ba'i sgra rna ba'i spyod yul du 'ongs pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra rna ba'i yul du 'ongs pa dang / sems 'khrug par byed pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa 'khrug par byed pa dang / dbang po drug 'phrog par byed pa dag dang 'grogs par gyur kyang sgra de lta bu dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i sems skad cig kyang sems rnam par 'khrug par mi 'gyur te/ dran pa rnam par 'khrug par mi 'gyur ro/ / spyod yul rnam par 'khrug bar mi 'gyur ro/ / mgo rmongs par mi 'gyur ro/ / 'khor bar mi 'gyur ro/ / bslad par mi 'gyur ro/ / byang chub sems dpa' de ni/ 'di ltar sgra de lta bu dag yid du 'ong zhing mthun par byed pa dang / yid du mi 'ong zhing khong khro bar byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med par grags par byed pa dag gis se gol gtogs pa tsam du'ang ting nge 'dzin las ldang bar mi 'gyur ro/ / spyod yul las ldang bar mi 'gyur ro/ / chos la 'jug pa las ldang bar mi 'gyur ro/ / byang chub kyi spyod pa la gcig tu 'dus pa las ldang bar mi 'gyur ro/ / byang chub kyi sems yongs su sgom pa las ldang bar mi 'gyur ro/ / sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa las ldang bar mi 'gyur ro/ / chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par brtags pa las ldang bar mi 'gyur ro/ / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i ye shes rgyun 'chad par mi 'gyur ro/ / sems can yongs su dag par bya ba'i gnas shes pa rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ro/ / don nges par shes pa rgyun 'chad par mi 'gyur ro/ /

“Having heard these teachings, enlightening beings keep them constantly in mind for an incalculable period of time. Why? When great enlightening beings cultivate practices over countless eons, they never afflict a single sentient being, which would cause loss of right mindfulness; they do not ruin the right teaching, and do not cut off roots of goodness—their minds are always expanding knowledge. Furthermore, these enlightening beings cannot be confused or disturbed by any kind of sound—loud sounds, coarse and garbled sounds, terrifying sounds, pleasing sounds, displeasing sounds, ear-shattering sounds, sense-debilitating sounds. When the enlightenings hear such countless good or bad sounds, even though the sounds fill countless worlds, they are never disturbed or distracted for a moment. That is to say, their right mindfulness is undisturbed, their state is undisturbed, their concentration is undisturbed, their entry into emptiness is undisturbed, their practice of enlightening acts is undisturbed, their determination for enlightenment is undisturbed, their recollection of the Buddhas is undisturbed, their contemplation of truth is undisturbed, their knowledge to civilize sentient beings is undisturbed, their knowledge to purify sentient beings is undisturbed, their certain understanding of the meaning of profundity is undisturbed.

gang gis las kyi sgrib par 'gyur ba'i sdig to'i las gsog par mi byed do/ / gang gis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib par 'gyur ba'i nyon mongs pa sdud par mi byed do/ / gang gis chos kyi sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos la rim gro byed par mi byed do/ / gang gis chos 'jig par 'ong ba'i sgrib par 'gyur ba dam pa'i chos yongs su spong bar mi byed do/ /

Because they do no evil, they have no obstruction of evil habits; because they do not produce afflictions, they have no obstruction by afflictions; because they do not slight the teaching, they have no barrier to the teaching; because they do not slander and repudiate the truth, they have no obstruction by retribution.

de la de lta bu'i sgra 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med par grags pa mi snyan pa dang / snyan pa bskal pa grangs med par mi sdod pa/ 'khrug par byed pa/ sems 'khrug pa/ lus 'khrug pa/ dbang po 'khrug pa/ mos par byed pa/ 'khor bar byed pa/ rnyog par byed pa/ rnam par rnyog par byed pa/ kun tu rnyog par byed pas dkrugs par byas kyang de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar sems skye ste/ bdag gis ni/ 'phags pa'i chos yongs su bsgoms pas nang du mnyam par gzhag par bya'o/ / snyam nas de sgra thams cad kyi skye ba la rab tu rtog go /gnas pa la rab tu rtog go /'gog pa la rab tu rtog go /skye ba'i rang bzhin la 'jug go /'gog pa'i rang bzhin la 'jug go /gang gis sgra de dag brjod pa de dag kyang de lta bu'i rang bzhin nyid du shes te/ sgras chags par mi 'gyur/ sgras khong khro bar mi 'gyur zhing / de'i dran pa nyams par mi 'gyur ro/ / de sgra de dag thams cad kyi mtshan ma 'dzin cing mtshan ma bskyed de/ sgras bsgo ba la mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ro/ / sgra la gnas par mi 'gyur ro/ / sgra la mngon par chags pa mi skyed do/ / des sgra de dag brtags na mi dmigs te/ sgra de dag thams cad kyi rang bzhin rab tu shes so/ / rang bzhin de yang byas pa med par khong du chud do/ / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i rgyas 'debs shing chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi tshul du chags pa med pa'i mthar yang rab tu shes so/ /

Even if the aforementioned sounds should each fill countless worlds ceaselessly for countless eons, each able to devastate the faculties, bodies and minds of sentient beings, they still could not damage the minds of these enlightening beings. Enlightening beings enter concentration, abide in the teaching of the Sage, and meditate on and investigate all sounds, becoming thoroughly familiar with the characteristics of origin, existence,’ and disappearance of all sounds, and come to know the nature of the origin, existence, and disappearance of all sounds: having heard them, they do not give rise to covetousness or aversion, and don’t lose mindfulness—they apprehend their characteristics precisely without being influenced by or attached to them. They know all sounds have no existence and are in reality ungraspable, that they have no creator and no origin, that they are equal to nirvana and have no differentiations.

'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa'i mthar thug pa/ phyir mi ldog pa mtha' yas pa/ bsam gtan gyi tshul tha dad pa thams cad la rab tu zhugs pa/ ting nge 'dzin thams cad la rgyud gcig gi tshul du zhugs pa/ chos thams cad mtha' dang dbus med par rab tu chud pa'i lus kyi las dben pa dang ldan pa/ ngag gi las dben pa dang ldan pa/ yid kyi las dben pa dang ldan pas/ shes pa rtogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ming dang sgra med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin grangs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang ldan pa 'thob ste/ snying rje chen po yang yangs shing tshad med par byed do/ /

“Thus do enlightening beings perfect tranquil, peaceful physical, verbal, and mental action, never regressing, till they reach omniscience. They skillfully enter all manner of meditative concentrations and know that all concentrations are of the same one essence. They comprehend that all things have no bounds and attain true knowledge of all things. They attain profound concentration detached from all sounds. They attain countless kinds of concentration. They increasingly develop a boundlessly vast mind of great compassion.

gal te de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin stong phrag grangs med pa sems kyi skad cig gcig gis thob par byed kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa de la de lta bu'i rnam par 'khrug pas dran pa rnam par 'khrug par mi nus kyi/ de phyir zhing 'di snyam du sems skye'o/ / de ltar bdag gis sems can de dag thams cad bla na med pa'i rnam par dag pa la rab tu bkod de/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las phyir mi ldog par byas la/ phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o/ / snyam mo/ /

“At this point enlightening beings attain countless concentrations in a single instant, and, hearing such sounds, are not disturbed—they gradually increase and broaden their concentration. They form this thought: I should get all beings to abide peacefully in unsurpassed pure mindfulness, so they may attain nonregression on the way to omniscience, and ultimately attain to nirvana without remainder.’
kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa lnga pa ste/ rmongs pa med pa zhes bya'o/ /
“This is called the enlightening beings’ fifth practice, leaving confusion behind.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa drug pa lta ba bzang po zhes bya ba de gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dmigs su med cing bstan pa mi dmigs/ lus kyi las dben pa dang / ngag gi las dben pa dang / yid kyi las dben pa thob pa yin/ ma chags ma bcings pa'i lus kyi las dang / ma chags ma bcings pa'i ngag gis las dang / ma chags ma bcings pa'i yid kyi las ma chags ma bcings par bstan pa/ gnas pa med pa/ mi gnas pa/ sems ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa/ sems kyi rang bzhin tshad med pa'i rjes su song ba/ chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin 'byams klas pa'i rjes su song ba/ mtshan nyid mi dmigs shing mtshan nyid bstan du med pa/ zab pa/ gting dpag par dka' ba/ de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su song ba/ rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i skyon med pa/ mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa/ 'gog pa dang mthun par gnas pa/ mya ngan las ma 'das pa'i dbyings kyi spyod yul can/ zhi ba'i rgyud rab tu thob ba/ dngos po med pa'i tshul gyi gzhir gyur pa/ tshig gi lam chad pa/ 'gro ba thams cad las 'phags pa; gnas med pa'i spyod pa rab tu thob pa/ byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i mtshan ma la mkhas pa/ rtogs pa bcings pa med pa la gnas pa/ de kho na nyid kyi chos kyi gnas kyi rjes su zhugs pa/ 'jig rten thams cad kyis mi brjod pa/ 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas dang ldan pa thob pa yin te/ de 'di snyam du sems so/ /

“What is the great enlightening beings’ practice of good manifestation? Here the enlightening beings are pure in thought, word, and deed; they abide in nonacquisition, and demonstrate nonacquisitive thought, word, and deed. They know that physical, verbal, and mental actions have no absolute existence. Because they are free from falsehood, they are free from bondage. What they demonstrate is without inherent nature and depends on nothing. They abide in mental accord with reality. They know the intrinsic nature of infinite minds. They know the inherent nature of all things is ungraspable, formless, exceedingly profound and difficult to penetrate. They abide in the absolute state, true thusness, the essence of things; they appear in life by way of expedients, yet have no retribution for actions. Unborn and undying, they abide in the dispassionate, tranquil nature of the realm of nirvana. They abide in the nature of true reality, absence of inherent reality or own-being. They are beyond the power of speech to fully describe, they transcend all worlds and do not depend on anything. They enter into the truth that is free from discrimination, bondage, and attachment. They enter the true principle of supreme knowledge. They enter the transcendental truth which cannot be understood or known by any worldlings. Such are the characteristics of the enlightening beings’ expedient manifestations of life.

kye sems can 'di dag thams cad ni/ rang bzhin 'di lta bu ste/ 'di ltar sems can med pa'i rang bzhin no/ / kye chos 'di dag thams cad ni/ rang bzhin 'di lta bu ste/ 'di ltar 'dus byas pa med pa'i rang bzhin no/ / kye zhing 'di dag thams cad ni/ 'di lta bu'i mtshan nyid de/ 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o/ / kye dus 'di dag thams cad ni; 'di lta bur byung ba ste/ 'di ltar tshig gi lam la gzhol zhing chos kun gyi rnam par tshig gi lam la shin tu gnas kyang chos thams cad ni/ tshig gi lam la mi gnas pa'o/ / zhes de de ltar chos thams cad zab pa'ang rab tu shes so/ / 'jig rten thams cad dben pa la yang rab tu 'jug go /de de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma bskyed pa la yang rab tu 'jug go /sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang 'jig rten gyi chos su rab tu 'jug go /'jig rten gyi chos kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos su rab tu 'jug go /sangs rgyas kyi chos dang 'jig rten gyi chos 'dres par mi byed do/ / 'jig rten gyi chos dang sangs rgyas kyi chos tha dad par yang mi byed do/ / 'di ltar dus gsum la gnas pa'i chos kyi dbyings tha dad pa med pa la yang rab tu 'jug go /byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po las kyang nyams par mi byed de/ sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba las kyang mi ldog ste/ sems can thams cad bskyab pa'i phyir snying rje chen po yang phyir zhing rab tu 'dzin par byed do/ /

“These enlightening beings formulate this thought: ‘The nature of all sentient beings is naturelessness; the nature of all phenomena is uncreated; the form of all lands of formlessness—in all worlds there only exists verbal expression, and verbal expression has no basis in facts. Furthermore, facts have no basis in words.’ Thus do enlightening beings understand that all things are void, and all worlds are silent: all the Buddha teachings add nothing—the Buddha teachings are no different from the phenomena of the world, and the phenomena of the world are no different from the Buddha teachings. The Buddha teachings and worldly phenomena are neither mixed up nor differentiated. Knowing that the nature of elements is equal, entering everywhere into the triple world, never giving up the determination for great enlightenment, never retreating from the will to transform sentient beings, ever expanding and increasing the heart of great compassion, they are a reliance for all living beings.

sems can gyi khams bdag gis smin par ma byas pa ni/ su zhig smin par byed/ sems can gyi khams bdag gis dul bar ma byas pa ni/ su zhig dul bar byed/ sems can gyi khams bdag gis zhi bar ma byas pa ni/ su zhig zhi bar byed/ sems can gyi khams bdag gis shes par ma byas pa ni/ su zhig shes par byed/ sems can gyi khams bdag gis dag par ma byas pa ni/ su zhig dag par byed de/ de ltar bdag gis de lta bur zab pa'i chos yang dag par mthong la/ gcig pu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par 'grol bar bya ba 'di ni/ bdag la tshul dang mi 'dra ba ste/ sems can gyi khams 'di'ang mya ngam chen po'i lam du zhugs pa/ nyon mongs pas kun nas bzung bas ldongs par gyur pa/ tshor ba nyams su bab pa mi zad pas nad par gyur pa/ sred pas bskor ba'i btson rar zhugs pa/ sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten nas ma g.yos pa/ sdug bsngal gyi phung pos mi skyo ba/ sdom pa gsum gyis gcugs su ma rung ba/ mun gang gi nang du rab tu zhugs pa/ ma rig pa'i mngal du skye ba dang 'chi bas mnar ba 'byung ba ma mthong bar mi khom par gyur pa/ mi khom pa brgyad thob pa/ sems kyi rab rib kyis dri ma can du gyur pa/ nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyi nad kyi yan lag gis btab pa/ mya ngam chen por 'khyams pa/ lta ba'i mya ngam gyis bskor ba'o/ / zhes de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi khams la rtog pa'i tshe sems 'di ltar skye ste/ de ltar bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs te/ ye shes kyi snang ba bla na med pa la zhugs nas sems can 'di dag yongs su ma smin cing rnam par ma dul bar bor te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba ni/ dus ma yin gyi/ bdag gis ni/ bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par sems can rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la yongs su smin par bya'o/ / dus de lta bus sems can byang chub tu yongs su ma smin pa rnams yongs su smin par bya'o/ / ma dul ba rnams gdul bar bya'o/ / snyam mo/ /

“Then enlightening beings also form this thought: ‘If I do not develop and mature sentient beings, who will? If I do not pacify and civilize sentient beings, who will? If I do not teach and renew sentient beings, who will? If I do not awaken sentient beings, who will? If I do not purify sentient beings, who will? This is my duty, my task.’ They also form this thought: ‘If I alone understand this profound teaching, then only I will attain liberation in unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment, while all sentient beings, being blind, will enter perilous paths, bound by afflictions, like people seriously ill constantly suffering pains. In the prison of craving and attachment, they are unable to get out by themselves. They will not leave the realms of hells, hungry ghosts, animals, or the netherworld; they cannot extinguish suffering or abandon evil deeds. Forever in the darkness of ignorance, they do not see reality. Revolving in birth and death, they have no means of emancipation. Living in the eight difficult situations, encrusted by all sorts of defilements, all manner of afflictions cover their minds. Deluded by false views, they do not travel the right path.’ Thus observing sentient beings, enlightening beings think, ‘It would not be proper for me to abandon these sentient beings while they are still undeveloped, immature, and unruly, and myself attain unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment. I should first transform these sentient beings, practicing enlightening deeds for unspeakably many eons, first developing the undeveloped, and taming the unruly.’

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa drug pa lta ba bzang po zhes bya ba ste/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams spyod pa de dag la gnas pas lha dang / bdud dang / tshangs par bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / dge sbyong dang / bram ze'i skye rgur bcas pa dang / lha dang / dri za dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis blta na mdzes shing / byang chub sems dpa' de mthong bas kyang sems can rnams bla na med pa yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu don yod par 'gyur ro// thos pa dang bsnyen bkur bas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu don yod par 'gyur ro/ / dmigs pa gang gis kyang rung ste/ byang chub sems dpa' de dang 'grogs pa thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu don yod par 'gyur ro/ /

“When these enlightening beings abide by this practice, if gods, demons, ascetics, priests, or inhabitants of any worlds—cherubim, titans, etc.—should get to see them, or sojourn with them for awhile, and honor and respect them, serve them and give them offerings, or even hear of them, once having crossed their minds these deeds will not be in vain—they shall surely attain perfect enlightenment.
“This is called the great enlightening beings’ sixth practice, the practice of good manifestation.
bam po nyi shu bdun pa/

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bdun pa gnas med pa zhes bya ba gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' gnas med pa'i sems kyis 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa la 'jug pa yin/ sems bskyed pa re res zhing grangs med pa yongs su sbyong ste/ zhing la gnas mi skyed pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das grangs med pa blta ba'i phyir 'gro zhing / me tog grangs med pa dang / spos grangs med pa dang / phreng ba grangs med pa dang / byug pa grangs med pa dang / phye ma grangs med pa dang / na bza' grangs med pa dang / rin po che grangs med pa dang / rgyal mtshan grangs med pa dang / ba dan grangs med pa dang / rgyan grangs med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba grangs med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i mthar phyin pa dang / grangs med pa'i bsam pas bsam du med pa'i chos la gnas par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das grangs med pa la blta ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur ba'i don du 'gro zhing / sems bskyed pa re re la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das grangs med pa mthong yang sangs rgyas de dag la gnas mi skyed pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams la gnas mi skyed pa yin/ mtshan rnams la gnas mi skyed pa yin/ dpe byad bzang po rnams la gnas mi skyed pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi 'od la gnas mi skyed pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan pa la gnas mi skyed pa yin/ phyogs la gnas mi skyed pa yin/ phyogs mtshams la gnas mi skyed pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor la gnas mi skyed pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun 'dus pa la gnas mi skyed pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad nyan cing dga' ba skyed de bsam pa yangs par byed la/ byang chub kyi sems rab tu 'dzin cing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la shin tu gnas kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos la gnas mi skyed pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa re re bsnyen bkur pa la yang bskal pa brjod du med pa zad par byed cing / sangs rgyas brjod du med pa mthong bas bskal pa grangs med par gnas kyang sangs rgyas blta ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mngon du bya ba dang / chos mnyan pas ngoms mi shes te/ sangs rgyas blta ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos mnyan pa la gnas mi skyed do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i rgyan dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang / de bzhin gshegs pa khong du chud par byed kyang gnas mi skyed/ chags pa'i sems mi skyed do/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kun nas nyon mongs pa la zhugs kyang khong khro ba mi skyed/ mos pa med pa'i sems mi skyed do/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin du shin tu khong du chud de/ de la ni/ kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang med/ rnam par byang ba'ang med/ mun pa'ang med/ snang ba'ang med/ rnam par phye ba'ang med/ rnam pa tha dad pa'ang med/ rnam par rtogs pa'ang med do/ / gzhan du 'gyur ba'ang med/ bde ba yang med/ mi bde ba yang med/ lam yang med/ lam ma yin pa'ang med do/ / byang chub sems dpa' de ltar chos kyi dbyings la zhugs pa ni/ sems can gyi khams la'ang 'jug ste/ de dag kyang yongs su smin par byed cing rnam par 'dul la/ sems can rnams la gnas skyed pa'ang med do/ / chos rnams kun nas thob par byed kyang chos la gnas mi skyed do/ / byang chub kyi sems la zhugs pa'i yid kyis 'tshang rgya bar bya ba la yang rnam par spyod de/ 'tshang rgya bar bya ba de la gnas mi skyed do// tshig gi lam yang brjod de/ tshig gi lam la gnas par yang mi byed do/ / sems can gyi rgyud la'ang 'jug ste/ sems can gyi rgyud la yang gnas par yang mi byed do; ; ting nge 'dzin kyang rab tu shes shing / de dag la'ang mnyam par gzhog ste/ ting nge 'dzin de dag la gnas kyi sems kyang mi skyed do/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med par 'gro zhing 'jug la/ de dag tu phyin te mthong zhing gnas kyang gnas kyi sems mi skyed do/ / de dag nas 'gro'ang chags pa'i sems mi skyed do/ / de dag sems 'di ltar skyed do/ /

“What is the great enlightening beings’ practice of nonattachment? These great enlightening beings, with minds free from attachment, can in every successive instant enter into countless worlds and adorn and purify these countless worlds, their minds free from attachment to anything in these worlds. They visit countless Buddhas, pay their respects, wait on them, and present them with offerings of countless flowers, perfumes, garlands, fragrant ointments, powdered incenses, clothes, jewels, banners, parasols, and various other adornments, all without number. These offerings are for the sake of the ultimate uncreated truth, for the sake of abiding in the inconceivable truth. In every instant they see countless Buddhas; their minds are free from attachment to the Buddha’s places, and they have no attachment to the buddha-lands either. They also have no attachment to the distinguishing marks of the Buddhas, and while they see the Buddhas’ auras of light and hear the Buddha’s sermons, yet they have no attachment. They also have no attachment to the congregations of the Buddhas and enlightening beings of the worlds of the ten directions.
“Having heard the Buddhas’ teachings, their minds are joyful, and the power of their will is greatly increased, so that they are able to encompass and carry out the practices of enlightening beings; yet they have no attachments.
“These enlightening beings, through unspeakably many eons, see untold Buddhas appear in the world; they attend and supply each Buddha for untold eons, never wearying of this. Seeing the Buddhas, hearing their teachings, and seeing the magnificent arrays of the assemblies of enlightening beings, they are unattached to any of them. And when they see impure worlds, they have no aversion. Why? Because these enlightening beings observe according to the Buddha teachings. In the teaching of the Buddhas, there is neither defilement nor purity, neither darkness nor light, neither difference nor unity, neither truth nor falsehood, neither security nor danger, no right path and no wrong path.
“Thus do enlightening beings enter deeply into the realm of reality, teaching and transforming sentient beings without forming attachments to sentient beings. They accept and hold the teaching, yet they do not form attachments to the teaching. They arouse the will for enlightenment and abide in the abode of the Buddhas, yet they do not form attachments to the abode of Buddhas. Though they speak, their minds have no attachment to speech. They enter the various realms of life with minds unattached to those realms. They comprehend concentration, can enter and can dwell in concentration, but they have no attachment to concentration. Going to visit countless buddha-lands, they may enter, see, or sojourn therein, but their minds have no attachment to buddha-lands, and when they leave they do not miss them.

kye sangs rgyas kyi chos de ltar gzung ba med/ sangs rgyas kyi byang chub de ltar sgrib pa med/ chos dang 'dul ba de ltar legs par bstan/ sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa de ltar legs par gnas/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa de ltar legs par 'dug / byang chub kyi sems de ltar legs par gnas/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa de ltar shin tu rtogs/ byang chub sems dpa'i rang bzhin de ltar chags pa med/ byang chub sems dpa'i tshul de ltar gnas pa med; byang chub sems dpa'i lam de ltar shin tu sbyangs/ byang chub sems dpa'i lung bstan pa de ltar byin gyis brlabs kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo 'di dag ni/ shes pa med pa/ mthong ba med pa/ tha dad pa med pa; mos pa med pa/ mi mkhas pa/ gnas la spyod pa/ bsam pa rmugs pa/ 'khor ba'i rgyud shin tu 'byung ba la gzhol ba/ sangs rgyas lta ba la log par zhugs pa; 'dren pa'i sa las nyams pa/ lam shes pa'i drung nas gar ba/ kha lo sgyur ba mi tshol ba/ stobs bcu la rim gro med pa/ byang chub sems dpa' la drin du mi gzo ba; dma' ba la gnas pa/ dngos po med pas 'jigs pa/ rigs bas spangs pa/ tshul bzhin ma yin pa la zhugs pa/ mnyam pa nyid las log par lhung ba/ g.yang sa chen por rab tu lhung ba/ bdud kyi bsam pa la zhugs pa/ sangs rgyas kyi bsam pa las ring du gyur pa/ srad pa la mngon par chags pa sha stag go /zhes de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi khams la 'jug cing / snying rje chen po de bas kyang cher bskyed nas snying rje chen po rgya cher byas te gnas med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par bsags nas 'di snyam du sems skyed do/ /

“Because great enlightening beings are able to be without attachment in this way, their minds have no barriers to the Buddha teaching. They comprehend the enlightenment of Buddhas, they realize the discipline of the teaching, they abide by the right teaching of the Buddhas and cultivate the practices of enlightening beings, they contemplate the enlightening beings’ methods of liberation. Their minds are free from attachment to the dwelling places of enlightening beings, and they also have no attachments to the practices of enlightening beings. They clear the way of enlightening beings and receive the prediction of enlightenment which is given to enlightening beings. Having received the prediction, they reflect, ‘Sentient beings are foolish and ignorant, without knowledge or vision, without faith or understanding, lacking in intelligent action, greedy and dishonest, covetous and grasping, revolving in the flow of birth and death — they do not seek to see the Buddha, they do not follow enlightened guides, they do not trust the Buddha; they are lost in error, mistakenly entering dangerous paths; they do not respect the Soviereign of the Ten Powers, they do not realize the benevolence of the enlightening beings. They are attached to their dwelling places, and when they hear that all things are empty, their minds are startled and frightened, and they shy away from the true teaching and abide in false teachings; they abandon the level, even path and enter perilous, difficult paths. They reject the ideas of the Buddha and pursue the ideas of demons. They are firmly and relentlessly attached to existents’. Thus observing sentient beings, enlightening beings increase in great compassion and develop roots of goodness — and yet they are unattached.

gal te sems can re re'i phyir yul re re dang / phyogs re rer yang bskal pa brjod du med par sems can re re 'dul ba'i phyir 'dug la/ sems can gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi don du 'dug kyang bdag gis de'i phyir mi dga' ba mi skyed de/ yul de dang phyogs de nas kyang bdag gud du g.yo bar mi bya'o/ /gud du 'gro bar mi bya'o/ /

“At this point enlightening beings also think, ‘I should, for the sake of a single sentient being, in each land in the worlds in the ten directions, spend countless eons teaching and developing, and should do the same for all sentient beings, without on this account wearying or giving up.’

skra'i rtse mo tsam la chos kyi dbyings thams cad 'dus par byas te/ skra'i rtse mo'i tshul de lta bus skra'i rtse mor chud pa re rer yang sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba'i phyir bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par gnas par bya'o/ / skra'i rtse mo gcig la ji lta bde bzhin du chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa thams cad la yang de ltar te/ se gol gtogs pa tsam du yang gnas kyi 'du shes mi skyed do/ / gnas par mi bya'o/ / gnas kyi sems mi skyed do/ / skra'i rtse mo tsam re re la yang lus gnas med pa dang / chos gnas med pa dang / dran pa gnas med pa dang / smon lam gnas med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gnas med pa dang / rtogs pa gnas med pa dang / spyod yul gnas med pa dang / sems can gyi khams 'dul ba gnas med pa dang / chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa gnas med pas phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal ba'i mur thug pa'i bskal par byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod do/ /

“Furthermore, measuring the entire universe with a hairtip, at a single point they pass unspeakably many unspeakable numbers of eons teaching, edifying, and civilizing all beings, and also do likewise at each and every point in the universe. Never for a moment do they cling to self or entertain any conception of self or possession. At each point they cultivate enlightening practice throughout the eons of the future, not attached to the body, not attached to phenomena, not attached to recollection, not attached to vows, not attached to concentration, not attached to contemplation, not attached to tranquil stabilization, not attached to spheres or objects, not attached to teaching and training sentient beings, and not attached to entering the realm of reality.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar sems skyed de/ bdag gis chos kyi dbyings thams cad sgyu ma lta bur shes par bya'o/ / bdag gis sangs rgyas thams cad bltar med pa'i tshul du mig yor lta bur shes par bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gnas med pa'i phyir rmi lam lta bur shes par bya'o/ / bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos bstan pa brag ca lta bur shes par bya'o/ / bdag gis las kyi rnam par smin pa'i mthu las byung bas 'jig rten thams cad sprul pa lta bur shes par bya'o/ / bdag gi spyod pa'i mthu las byung bas lus ni/ yid kyi rgyu las byung bar shes par bya'o/ / bdag gis sna tshogs dang 'dres pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad ni/ sems lta bur shes par bya'o/ / rnam par 'gyur ba med pas bdag gis chos thams cad ni/ yang dag pa'i mtha' dang mnyam par bstan par bya'o/ / bdag gis phyogs bcur sems bskyed pas rgyas par bkang ste chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas par bya'o/ /

“Why? The enlightening beings form this thought: ‘I should look upon all objective realms as like phantoms, all Buddhas as like reflections, enlightening practices as like dreams, Buddhas’ sermons as like echoes; all worlds are like illusions, because they are upheld by the consequences of actions; differentiated bodies are like apparitions, because they are produced by the power of deeds; all sentient beings are like mind, because they are defiled by various influences; all things are like the limit of reality, because they cannot change.’
bdag gis sems yangs par bsgyur ba dang / dran pa gnas med pas/ sangs rgyas kyi chos khong du chud cing mkhas pa sems kyi skad cig gcig gis thob par bya'o/ / zhes

“They also form this thought: ‘I should carry on enlightening practices in all lands, in all worlds throughout space, moment after moment clearly realizing all truths taught by the Buddha, with precise presence of mind, free from attachments.’

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de bdag dang sangs rgyas la bdag med pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par lta zhing / sems can chags pa med pa'i mthar phyin pa'i tshig gi lam gyis la smin par byed pa'i tshe dga' ba mtha' yas pa 'thob bo/ / sangs rgyas dang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos la mos pa tshad med pa'ang yang dag par rab tu 'thob bo/ / sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i don du bdag gis skyo ba'i sems mi skyed do/ / sems can gyi khams yongs su ma smin cing ma dul gyi bar du skyo ba'i smon lam mi skyed do/ / bdag gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad las rnam par 'das par 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rgyu bar byas te smon lam gang la sems can gyi sgra yod pa dang / sems can gyi las dang / sems can nye bar len pa dang / sems can rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems can gyi 'du shes dang ldan pa dang / sems can gyi glong dang / sems can gyi 'du byed dang / sems can gyi yul dang / sems can gyi 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi ldog pa yod pa de la bdag gis gnas par bya'o/ / sems can thams cad 'dul ba'i dbang du smon lam de las g.yo bar yang mi bya ste/ sems bskyed pa gcig gis kyang gnas kyi 'du shes bskyad par mi bya'o/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ bdag gis gnas med pa dang mi gnas par bya ste/ bdag gi don yongs su sbyang bar bya'o/ / yongs su rdzogs par bya'o/ / zhes bya ba

“Thus do enlightening beings observe that the body has no self, and they see the Buddha without hindrance. In order to transform sentient beings, they expound various teachings, to cause them to have unlimited joy and pure faith in the Buddha’s teaching. They rescue all without weariness of mind. Because they are unwearied, if there are any sentient beings in any world who are not mature or unruly in any way, they go there and employ expedient methods to transform and liberate them. By virtue of great commitment and will they remain secure among those beings, various kinds of speech, deeds, attachments, devices, associations, routines, activities, perspectives, births, and deaths, and teach them, not letting their minds be disturbed or discouraged, and never for a moment forming any thought of attachment. Why? Because they have attained nonattachment and independence. Their own benefit and the benefit of others is fulfilled with purity.
'di ni/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bdun pa ste/ gnas med pa zhes bya'o/ /
This is called the great enlightening beings’ seventh practice, of nonattachment.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thub par dka' ba zhes bya ba brgyad pa gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thub par dka' ba/ gdul bar dka' ba/ rab tu 'dul bar dka' ba/ phyed par dka' ba/ zil gyis mi non pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ kun tu mtha' yas pa/ mi 'phrog pa/ bdag nyid che ba/ rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zham ring na byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi chos la shin tu dad pa yin/ yangs par dad pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub la shin tu mos pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa yin/ bskal pa thams cad du mi skyo ba'i sems dang ldan pa yin/ sdug bsngal thams cad kyis sgyid lug par 'gyur ba med pa yin/ bdud thams cad kyis phyir brgal du med pa yin/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs ba yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i dka' thub thams cad kyis rnam par sbyangs pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i brtul zhugs kyis tshad mi shes pa yin/ theg pa chen po'i smon lam las phyir mi ldog pa yin/

“What is the great enlightening beings’ practice of that which is difficult to attain? Here the enlightening beings perfect roots of goodness which are difficult to attain, invincible roots of goodness, supreme roots of goodness, indestructible roots of goodness, unsurpassable roots of goodness, inconceivable roots of goodness, inexhaustible roots of goodness, independently powered roots of goodness, greatly influential roots of goodness, roots of goodness which are of the same essence as all Buddhas.
“When these enlightening beings carry out their practice, they attain supreme understanding of the Buddha-teaching, they attain broad understanding of the Buddhas’ enlightenment. They never give up the vows of enlightening beings, and for all ages their minds never weary. They do not shrink from suffering, and they cannot be moved by any demons. Under the care of all Buddhas, they fully carry out all the difficult undertakings of enlightening beings. In cultivating enlightening practices, they are diligent and energetic, never lazy. They never retreat from the vow of universal salvation.

de la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sgrub par dka' ba la gnas te sems bskyed pa gcig gis bskal pa grangs med par 'khor yang phyir mi ldog pa yin te/ byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam chen po'ang rgyun mi gcod do/ / de mthong ba tsam gyis kyang sems can rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par byed do/ / thos pa dang bsnyen bkur bas kyang sems can rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par byed do/ /

“Once the enlightening beings abide in these difficult to accomplish practices, they are able to transmute immeasurable ages of birth and death in every instant, without giving up the great vow of enlightening beings. If any sentient beings serve and support them, or even see or hear of them, they all will attain nonregression on the way to unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.

sems can thams cad sems can med par yang shes te/ sems can gyi khams yongs su gtong ba ma yin no/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ mnyan pa ni/ pha rol tu 'gro ba'ang ma yin/ tshu rol tu 'gro ba'ang ma yin/ chu klung gi gzhung la gnas pa'ang ma yin/ 'gro ba dang 'ong ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir pha rol dang pha rol ma yin par sems can rnams kyang sgrol lo/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'khor bar 'gro ba'ang ma yin; mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'ang ma yin/ 'khor ba'i rgyud la gnas pa'ang ma yin/ tshu rol gyi mu nas sems can rnams bskyod de/ pha rol gyi dogs [*ngogs?] bde pa; 'jigs pa med pa/ 'tshe ba med pa/ 'khrug pa med par rab tu bzhag kyang sems can gyi khams bgrangs pa'i tshul gyis mngon par chags pa med do/ / sems can gcig las bskyod nas mang po la mngon par chags par yang mi byed/ mang po las bskyod nas sems can gcig la mngon par chags par yang mi byed/ sems can gyi khams 'phel bar yang mi byed/ 'bri bar yang mi byed/ sems can gyi khams skye bar yang mi byed/ 'gog par yang mi byed/ zad par yang mi byed/ gsog par yang mi byed/ rnam par rtog par yang mi byed/ rnam pa gnyis su yang mi byed do/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni/ sems can gyi khams la zhugs shing khong du chud pa ste/ chos kyi dbyings ji lta bar sems can gyi khams kyang de bzhin te/ sems can gyi khams dang chos kyi dbyings de la gnyis su med do; ; gnyis su med pa'i chos la ni/ 'bri ba'am/ 'phel ba'am/ 'gags pa'ang med de/ chos kyi rang bzhin ni/ rang bzhin gyis med par 'gyur ba'am/ len pa'am/ gnas pa'am/ mngon par chags pa'am/ gnyis su 'gyur ba med do/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings bstan pa'i tshul du gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro/ /

“Though the enlightening beings understand that sentient beings are not existent, yet they do not abandon the realms of sentient beings. They are like ship captains, not staying on this shore, not staying on the other shore, not staying midway, yet able to ferry sentient beings from this shore over to the other shore, because they are always traveling back and forth. In the same way enlightening beings do not stay in birth and death, do not stay in nirvana, and also do not stay in midstream of birth and death, while they are able to deliver sentient beings from this shore to the other shore, where it is safe and secure, without sorrow or trouble. And they have no attachment to the numbers of sentient beings—they do not abandon one being for attachment to many beings, and do not abandon many beings for attachment to one being. They neither increase nor decrease the realms of sentient beings; they neither exhaust nor perpetuate the realms of sentient beings; they neither discriminate nor bifurcate the realms of sentient beings. Why? Enlightening beings enter deeply into the realms of sentient beings as the realm of truth; the realms of sentient beings and the realm of truth are nondual. In the nondual there is no increase or decrease, no origination or destruction, no existence or nonexistence, no grasping and no reliance, no attachment and no duality. Why? Because enlightening beings realize that all things and the realm of truth are nondual.

de ltar na/ byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings rab tu dbye ba'i mkhas pa khong du chud pa yin te/ mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa'i lus dang / dngos po med pa yongs su/ shes pa dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin yongs su rtogs pas mtshan nyid med pa la gnas pa yin/ de ni/ sems can rnam pa sna tshogs kyang shes/ sems can gyi grangs kyang shes te/ 'jig rten gyi khams rnams la'ang mngon par chags pa med do/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du yang snang ngo/ / sangs rgyas rnams la'ang 'jug cing khong du chud par byed de/ las la rnam par rtog par mi byed do/ / don kyang shin tu rtogs pa yin no/ / don gyi yi ge yang yongs su brjod do/ / chos 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mthar phyin pa thams cad kyang shes so/ / rab tu shes so/ / khong du chud do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang yang mi 'bral te/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las kyang phyir mi ldog go/ chos kyi dbyings su gzud pa la dbang bsgyur bar zhugs pas zad mi shes pa'i spyad pa dang ldan pa yin no/ /

“Thus do enlightening beings, by means of appropriate techniques, enter into the profound realm of truth and abide in formlessness while adorning their bodies with pure forms. They understand that things have no intrinsic nature, yet they are able to distinguish the characteristics of all things. They do not grasp sentient beings, yet they are able to know the numbers of sentient beings. They are not attached to worlds, yet they appear physically in Buddha-lands. They do not discriminate principles, yet they enter skillfully into the Buddha teachings; they profoundly understand their meanings and principles and extensively expound the verbal teachings. They comprehend the dispassionate reality of all things, yet do not cease the path of enlightening. They do not withdraw from enlightening, they always diligently cultivate inexhaustible practice. They freely enter the pure realm of reality.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ gtsub ma las byung ba'i me'i rgyu tshad med pas me'i dgos pa las ma 'gag pa yin te/ de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' pa 'jig rten thams cad na sems can gyi don las 'gag pa med par zhugs pa yin te/ kun gyi mthar byas pa'ang ma yin/ kun gyi mtha' med par byas pa'ang ma yin no/ / nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'ang ma yin/ nye bar len pa med pa yang ma yin no/ / gnas pa'ang ma yin no/ / mi gnas pa yang ma yin no/ / 'jig rten gyi chos kyi rjes su song ba'ang ma yin/ sangs rgyas kyi chos la gzhol ba'ang ma yin no/ / so so'i skye bo yang ma yin/ 'bras bu la gnas pa'ang ma yin no/ /

“It may be likened to drilling wood to produce fire: fires may be unlimited but the fire doesn’t go out. In the same way do enlightening beings liberate people without end, yet they remain in the world forever without becoming extinct. They neither do nor do not reach an ultimate end; neither do nor do not grasp, neither do nor do not rely, are neither worldlings or Buddhists, neither ordinary people nor realized people.

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' thub par dka' ba'i sems dang ldan pa spyad pa la spyod de/ de ni/ nyan thos kyi theg pa mi ston to/ / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mi ston to/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang ston pa med do/ / 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten gyi chos nye bar len pa med do/ / sems can dang / sems can 'jig rten pa nye bar len pa med do/ / nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba nye bar len pa med do/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ chos thams cad kun nas nyon mongs pa med par byang chub sems dpa' yongs su shes so/ / chos thams cad nye bar blang pa med par byang chub sems dpas yongs su shes so/ / chos thams cad zhugs pa med par byang chub sems dpas yongs su shes so/ / chos thams cad ldog pa med par byang chub sems dpas yongs su shes so/ /

“When enlightening beings accomplish this difficult-to-attain state of mind, and cultivate enlightening practice, they do not preach the doctrines of the two vehicles, they do not preach buddhism, they do not talk about the world, they do not expound worldly doctrines, they don’t explain sentient beings, they don’t say there are no sentient beings, they don’t talk about purity or defilement. Why? Because enlightening beings know all things have no defilement and no grasping, do not proceed and do not recede.

de de ltar zhi zhing phra ba dang / zab pa dang / bzang po'i chos la spyod pa'i tshe spyod do/ / zhes bya bar mi dmigs so/ / spyad par bya'o/ / zhes bya bar mi dmigs so/ / khams kyi yul dang / skye mched kyi yul dang / nang gi snang ba dang / phyi rol gyi snang ba dang / phyi nang gi snang ba dang / smon lam yongs su sgrub pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / chos thams cad du yang mi dmigs so/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings thams cad la ni/ gang nyan thos kyi theg pa la zhugs pa'am/ rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la zhugs pa'am/ byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la zhugs pa'am/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs pa'am/ so so'i skye bo'i khams la zhugs pa'am/ kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khams la zhugs pa'am/ rnam par byang ba'i khams la zhugs pa'am/ 'khor ba'i khams la zhugs pa'am/ mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams la zhugs pa'i chos gang yang med do/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di la chos gnyis zhes bya ba gang yang med de/ mi gnyis pa'ang med do/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nam mkha' ni/ phyogs bcur ma rnyed/ mi rnyed/ rnyed par mi 'gyur yang nam mkhar bgrang ba'i tshul yod do/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpas kyang chos gang yang dmigs pa med de/ chos thams cad mngon par 'tshang rgya'o/ / zhes grangs su bgrang ba yang yod de; de ni/ yang dag pa bden pa ste/ log pa ma yin no/ / de ni/ bya ba dang mi 'gal ba'i spyod pa'ang ston te/ smon lam yang mi gtong ngo/ / sems can gyi khams yongs su smin pa dang gdul ba'ang byed do/ / chos kyi 'khor lo yang bskor ro/ / rgyu dang 'bras bu yang 'jig par mi byed do/ / chos nyid dang yang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang yang mnyam par 'gyur ba yin te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyang rgyun chad par mi byed/ chos kyi tshul dang yang 'gal bar mi byed/ chos kyi rgyud kyang rab tu shes so/ / chos kyi spobs pa'ang 'jig par mi byed/ chos thos pas kyang rlom sems med de/ chos kyi 'byung gnas kyang rab tu thob/ chos brjod pa yang rab tu byed/ mi 'jigs pa la'ang rab tu gnas/ sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'ang mi gtong ngo/ / 'jig rten gyi tshul yang 'gog par mi byed/ 'jig rten mnyam pa nyid kyang rab tu ston te/ 'jig rten gyi spyod pa rnams la'ang gnas pa med do/ /

“When enlightening beings practice this dispassionate, subtle, extremely deep and all-surpassing teaching, they do not think ‘I am cultivating this practice, have cultivated this practice, will cultivate this practice.’ They are not attached to physical or mental elements, or to sense faculties, sense consciousness, or sense data, or to inner or outer worlds. The great vows they undertake, their transcendent ways, and all their methods are without attachments. Why? Because in the realm of truth there are no names corresponding to reality; in the vehicle of listeners and the vehicle of the self-awakened there are no real names; in the vehicle of enlightening beings there are no real names; in perfect enlightenment there are no real names; in the world of ordinary people there are no real names, nor in purity or impurity, in birth and death or nirvana. Why? Because all things are nondual, yet none are not dual. They are like space, which anywhere in the universe, whether past, present, or future, cannot be apprehended, yet it is not that there is no space. Thus do enlightening beings observe all things to be ungraspable, yet not nonexistent. They see things as they are, without neglecting their tasks, everywhere demonstrating the practices of enlightening activities; they do not give up their great vows, civilizing sentient beings, turning the wheel of true teaching. They do not violate cause and effect and do not deny it, and do not deviate from the impartial truth. Equal to the Buddhas of all times, they do not cut off the lineage of buddhahood, they do not violate the character of reality. Entering deeply into the teaching, their expository ability is endless. They hear the teaching without attachment; reaching the profound depths of the teaching, they are able to expound it skillfully, hearts without fear. They do not give up the abode of Buddhas, but they do not violate natural laws; they appear throughout the world, yet are not attached to the world.

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' thub par dka' pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa la spyod de/ sems can gyi khams kyang sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten nas gyen du bskyod de/ de dag bskyed nas kyang yongs su smin par byed do/ / 'dul bar byed do/ / rab tu gzhog bar byed do/ / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi lam gyi rgyud las kyang mi g.yo'o/ /

“Thus do enlightening beings achieve the mind of wisdom which is difficult to attain. Cultivating various practices, they free sentient beings from the three woeful states of hell, ghosthood, and animality, teaching and enlightening, taming and civilizing, placing them on the Way of the Buddhas of all times, making them unshakable.

'jig rten gnas pa drin du mi gzo bas yongs su gang ba dang / dgras yongs su gang ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pas yongs su gang ba dang / mi mthun pas yongs su gang ba dang / yid gzhag tu mi rung bas yongs su gang ba dang / byis pas yongs su gang ba dang / ma dad pas yongs su gang ba dang / gzhan gyi dring la rgyug pas yongs su gang ba dang / shes rab ngan pas shin tu byung ba dang / 'jig rten gnas pa sred pa'i bsam pa dang / ma rig pas kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa na byang chub sems dpa' ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod de/ de 'di snyam du sems so/ / 'di ltar bdag gis 'jig rten gnas pa drin du gzo bas yongs su gang ba dang / mdza' bos yongs su gang ba dang / mkhas pas yongs su gang bar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa lta ngo mtshar du'ang ci che ste/ de ji lta zhe na/ bdag ni/ sems can mdza' ba'am/ mi mdza' ba gang las kyang chung du na skra'i rtse mo gcig tsam mam/ chung du na dge bar bya ba sbyin pa tsam yang mi 'dod mi tshol te/ phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal par byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod kyang gzhan du na sems can de dag yongs su 'grol ba dang / sems can de dag yongs su dag par 'gyur ba dang / sems can de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma gtogs par de dag las sems skad cig tsam du bde bar 'gyur ba'ang mi tshol lo/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ bdag ni/ sems la len pa med cing thams cad la 'dod pa med pas/ sems can gyi gtso bor 'gyur bar byed pa ste/ 'di ltar bdag gis ci nas kyang sems can de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi mthas gtugs te/ shin tu bde ba'i pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur bar nan tan du bya'o/ / snyam mo/ /

“Furthermore, they form this thought: ‘Beings in the world are ungrateful and even hostile to one another; with false views and clinging attachments, illusions and delusions, they are ignorant and unwise; having no faith, they follow bad associates, and develop various kinds of perverse cleverness. They are full of various afflictions, like craving and ignorance. This is where I am to cultivate the practice of enlightening beings. If people who are grateful, intelligent, wise and knowing filled the world, I would not cultivate the practices of enlightening beings therein. Why? I have no attraction or opposition to sentient beings, I seek nothing from them, I do not seek even so much as a single word of praise.’ Cultivating enlightening practices forever and ever, they never have a single thought of doing it for themselves—they only want to liberate all sentient beings, to purify them so that they attain eternal emancipation. Why? Because those who would be enlightened guides must be thus—not grasping, not seeking, just practicing the enlightening Way for the sake of beings, to enable them to reach the peaceful, secure other shore and attain complete perfect enlightenment.
kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa brgyad pa ste/ thub par dka' ba zhes bya'o/ /
“This is called the great enlightening beings’ eighth practice, that which is difficult to attain.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dgu pa chos bzang po zhes bya ba gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pa/ bdud dang bcas pa/ tshangs pa dang bcas pa/ dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye rgu dang / lha dang / dri za dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa na chos kyi mu stegs bzang por gyur pa yin te/ de sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi gcad pa'i phyir dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin par byed pa yin/ gzungs kyi snang ba rnam par dag pa thob pas gtam bya ba dang / lung bstan pa la spobs pa yin/ chos dang ldan pa'i gzungs thob pas don la spobs pa yin/ chos ji lta ba bzhin gyi gzungs chos yang dag par skul ba thob pas chos la spobs pa yin/ tshig dang smra ba thams cad kyi gzungs rab tu thob pas nges pa'i tshig la spobs pa yin/ tshig dang yi ge'i don kun tu mtha' yas shing zad mi shes pa la thogs pa med pa'i sgo'i gzungs thob pas spobs pa thogs pa med pa yin/ sangs rgyas dbang bskur ba'i gzungs kyi dbang bskur bas mngon par dga' bar byed pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa yin/ gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i gzungs kyi sgo thob pas snang ba thob pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa yin/ spobs pa thun mong pa'i tshul la zhugs pas thun mong gi spobs pa dang ldan pa yin te/ don mang po dang / tshig mang po dang / yi ge mang po de dang de dag la nges pa'i tshig gis gzungs kyi sgor tshud pas nges pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa yin/ rgyud mtha' yas pa'i gzungs thob pas mtha' yas pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa yin te/

“What is the great enlightening beings’ practice of good teachings? Here the enlightening beings act as pure, cool reservoirs of truth for the sake of beings of all worlds—celestial and human beings, devils and gods, ascetics and priests, etc. Maintaining true teaching, they do not let the seed of buddhahood be cut off. Because they attain the spell of pure light, in teaching and predicting enlightenment their intellectual powers are inexhuastible. Because they attain the spell of complete meaning their comprehension of meanings is inexhaustible. Because they attain the spell of realization of true principles, their comprehension of principles is inexhaustible. Because they attain the spell of explanatory expression, their comprehension of words is inexhaustible. Because they attain the spell of nonobstruction of inexhaustible meanings of boundless words and phrases, their unimpeded comprehension is inexhaustible. Because they attain the spell of nonobstruction of inexhaustible meanings of boundless words and phrases, their unimpeded comprehension is inexhaustible. Because they are anointed by the spell of the Buddhas’ coronation, their delightful eloquence is inexhaustible. Because they attain the spell of enlightenment without relying on another, their illuminating discourse is inexhaustible. Because they attain the spell of adaptive explanation, their adaptive discourse is inexhaustible. Because they attain the spell of elucidation and analysis of all kinds of bodies of words, phrases, and sentences, their explanatory eloquence is inexhaustible. Because they attain the spell of boundless versatility, their boundless elucidation is inexhaustible.

des ni/ stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi don du bdag gi lus gser gyi mdog tu mngon par sprul nas chos 'byams klas pa thams cad dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo thams cad du chud pas sems can de dag de dag 'dul ba'i dbang du bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du brjod pa dang / dbang po 'byams klas pa mtha' yas pa rnams la lce yangs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis dbyangs kyi yan lag rnam par dag pa dang / dus dang 'byor ba'i chos bstan pa dang snying rje chen po 'gal ba med pas shin tu bstan pa dang / tshig gcig gi sgra brjod pas 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du tshim par 'gyur zhing mtha' yas par snang bar ston pas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa la spyod do/ / de ni/ gal te sems can re re zhing chog rnam pa tha dad pa'i tshig gi cho ga las sna tshogs kyis mngon par 'du byas pa/ rnam par smin pa brjod kyis mi lang zhing 'byams klas pas nye bar gnas pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ grangs med pa/ rnam par phye ba; rnam pa tha dad pa/ brjod du med pa dang ldan pa de lta bu'i sems can sha stag byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor du gyur la/ 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yang 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa tsam du yangs pa zhig yin te/ 'dul ba brjod du med pa zhig 'dus nas sems can re re la yang kha'i sgo bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pa brjod du med pa yod par gyur te/ sems can gcig ji lta bar sems can de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin du de snyed kyi kha'i sgo dang ldan pa/ sems can de dag thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' la skad du brjod pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pa rnam par brtags pas dus gcig tu dbyangs gcig tu 'phyas te yongs su dri bar byas kyang byang chub sems dpa' ni/ de lta bu'i sems can gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / de lta bu'i skad gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / de lta bu'i brjod pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su dris pa la'ang chos gzung ba la thogs pa med pa yin/ brjod pa shes par bya ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa yin te/ dri bas the tshom yongs su dris pa la thogs pa med do/ / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gcig tu ji lta ba de bzhin du 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor brjod du med pa de tsam thams cad du yang de bzhin te/ de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems so/ /

“The great compassion of these enlightening beings is strong and steadfast, extending to all creatures. Throughout the universe they change their bodies to a golden color and carry out the deeds of Buddhas time and time again; adapting to the faculties, natures, and inclinations of sentient beings, with a universal tongue within one voice they manifest unlimited sounds, teaching as appropriate to the occasion, bringing joy to all. Even if there were countless beings in innumerable conditions, all in the same assembly, that assembly so vast it fills untold worlds, and each had innumerable mouths each capable of producing billions of sounds, and each should ask the enlightening beings different questions all at once, the enlightening beings would be able to take on all the questions instantly and reply to them and cause their doubts to be removed. As this is true of one assembly, so it is also of countless assemblies.

gal te skra'i rtse mo re re las sems bskyed par re re zhing 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor brjod du med pa zhig byung la/ sems skad cig re re la rtog pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis skad gzhan dang gzhan du brjod pas chos kyi dbyings thams cad gang bar byed cing / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnam pa de lta bu sha stag cig skra'i rtse mo thams cad las byung ste/ de ltar byung bas phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par byung yang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de dag byung bas phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug pa zad par gyur te; 'khor de rnams ni/ zad mi shes par byung la/ skye ba'i rgyun mi 'chad pa zhig yod du zin na yang / bstan par bya ba'i sa de la byang chub sems dpa' sems skad cig pa 'ga' tsam du yang zhum pa mi skye'o/ / snyoms pa mi skye'o/ / sgyid lug dang khong snyom mi skye'o/ / the tshom dang yid gnyis mi skye'o/ / bag tsha ba dang 'jigs pa mi skye'o rmongs pa dang 'khrul pa mi skye'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' chos bzang po la gnas pa de ni/ 'di snyam du sems te/ bdag gis sems can 'di dag dang / sems can gzhan rnams dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad kyang tshig gi lam gyis yongs su mgu bar byas te chos bshad pa'i mthar thug par mi bya/ chos la rnam par thogs par mi bya'o/ / zhes nas des brjod pa de dag thams cad kyang rab tu shes te/ sems can de dag la brtag mi dgos par 'byung ba'i tshig dang / tshig gi cho ga rnam pa tha dad pa brtag mi dgos par 'byung ba dang / tshig gi rnam par gdags pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par 'byung bas chos ston par byed do/ / de brjod pa de dag thams cad kyang 'dzin la/ sems kyi skad cig gcig gis kyang tshig thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dbang bskur ba/ chags pa med pa'i snying po can/ chos thams cad kyi snang ba rab tu thob pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la gzhol ba gcig gis sems can thams cad kyang go bar byed do/ /

“Furthermore, even if every single spot as big as a hairtip should in every successive moment produce unspeakably many unspeakable numbers of congregations, throughout the eons of the future—those eons may be exhausted, but the congregations are infinite—and all of them should every moment ask different questions in different words, enlightening beings could receive them all in a single instant, without fear or timidity, without doubt or error, thinking, ‘Even if all sentient beings come and question me, I will expound the truth to them ceaselessly, endlessly, causing them all to rejoice and dwell in the path of virtue, and also cause them to understand all words and expressions and be able to explain various principles to sentient beings, yet without discrimination in regard to language. Even if they come and ask difficult questions in countless various ways of speaking, I will receive them all at once and answer them all in one voice, causing them all to understand, without omitting anything.’ This is because they have been anointed with omniscience, because they have found the unobstructed treasury of the potential of enlightenment, because they have attained the sphere of light of all truths, and because they are replete with universal knowledge.

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa chos bzang po la gnas pa ni/ mngon par chags pa med pa'i tshul gyis bdag rnam par dag pa'ang rab tu 'thob bo/ / sems can med par 'byung ba'i tshul gyis sems can thams cad kyi don kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ /

“Once the enlightening beings abide in the practice of good teachings, they can purify themselves, and also can benefit all sentient beings by appropriate means without attachments, not seeing that there are any sentient beings that attain emancipation.

de ni/ dus gcig tu stong gsum pa bcu nas stong gsum pa brjod kyis mi lang ba'i don du byin gyis brlabs shing / bdag gis lus gser gyi mdog tu mngon par sprul te dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad shes pa'i sgor chud pa/ chos thams cad du khyab pas mtha' dang dbus med pa'i chos kyi sgor 'jug cing sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las sgrub ste/
“As they do in this universe, so in countless universes do they turn golden, and, fully equipped with the wondrous voice, with no barrier to any truth, perform Buddha work.

'jig rten thams cad du rgyu ba 'gag pas 'gro ba med pa'i lus rnams dang / 'gro pa thams cad du 'byung bas mtha' yas par 'gro ba'i lus rnams dang / mi skye ba dang mnyam pa'i chos la brtson pas ma skyes pa'i lus rnams dang / 'gog par brjod pa thams cad dmigs pa med pas 'gag pa med pa'i lus rnams dang / ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pas bden pa med pa'i lus rnams dang / 'jig rten gyi bden pa bzhin du rnam par dmigs pas mi slu ba'i lus rnams dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba las 'das pas mi 'pho ba'i lus rnams dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin 'jig par mi byed pas mi 'jig ba'i lus rnams dang / dus gsum gyi tshig gi lam la brtson pas skad cig gcig gi lus rnams dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs pa'i mthar thug pas mtshan nyid med pa'i lus rnams dang /

“These enlightening beings develop ten kinds of body: the transcendent body which enters into boundless realms, due to annihilating all worldliness; the immanent body which enters into boundless realms, due to birth in all worlds; the unborn body, due to abiding in the impartiality of birthlessness; the undying body, due to all expression of extinction being ungraspable; the nonreal body, due to attainment of accord with reality; the nonfalse body, due to adaptive appearance; the unchanging body, being removed from death in one place and rebirth in another; the nondisintegrating body, the nature of the realm of reality being indestructible; the uniform body, being beyond all manner of speaking, past, present, or future; the formless body, due to ability to observe the characteristics of things.

lus rnam par phye ba 'byams klas pa bcu po de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bskyed pa la sems can thams cad kyi gnas yin no/ / dbugs chen po phyin par bya ba la sems can thams cad kyi dpud [*dpung?] gnyen yin no/ / gnas chen po thob par bya ba la sems can thams cad kyi skyabs yin no/ / bla na med pa'i 'byung ba mthong bar bya ba la sems can thams cad kyi rten yin no/ / chos kyi tshul la 'jug par bya ba la sems can thams cad kyi 'dren pa yin no/ / las kyi rnam par smin pa rnam par dmigs par bya ba la sems can thams cad kyi me mar yin no/ / chos zab mo rab tu thob par bya ba la 'jig rten thams cad kyi snang ba yin no/ / chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rmongs pa med par khong du chud par bya ba la khams gsum thams cad kyi sgron ma yin no/ / snang ba'i sa rab tu thob par bya ba la 'jig rten thams cad kyi snang ba yin no/ / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa yang dag par bstan par bya ba la 'gro ba thams cad rab tu dga' ba yin no/ /

“Developing these ten bodies, enlightening beings are a house for all sentient beings, because they raise all roots of goodness; they are saviors for all sentient beings, because they enable them to attain great peace; they are a refuge for all sentient beings, because they act as a great reliance for them; they are guides for all sentient beings, because they enable them to attain unsurpassed emancipation; they are teachers of all sentient beings, because they cause them to enter into the truth; they are lamps for all sentient beings, because they cause them to see clearly the consequences of actions; they are lights for all sentient beings, because they cause the extremely profound wondrous truth to be illuminated; they are a torch for all in all times, because they cause them to clearly understand the truth; they are illumination for all worlds, because they cause them to enter the state of radiant light; they are clarifiers for all realms of being, because they reveal the powers of the enlightened.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dgu pa chos bzang po zhes bya ba ste/ de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad du 'jug par bya ba la 'gro ba thams cad kyi mu stegs yin no/ /

“This is called the great enlightening beings’ ninth practice, of good teachings. When enlightening beings abide in this practice, they are a pure cool reservoir of truth for all sentient beings, because they can plumb the source of all the Buddha teachings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bcu pa bden pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bden pa'i tshig dam pa dang ldan pas bden pa'i tshig can yin te/ de ni/ gang smras pa de byed/ gang byed pa de smra'o/ / de 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bden pa'i gsung la yang slob bo/ / ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bden pa'i gsung la yang slob bo/ / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bden pa'i gsung la'ang slob bo/ / 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rigs la'ang 'jug go / ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rigs la'ang 'jug go /da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rigs la'ang 'jug go /'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang 'thob bo/ / ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang 'thob bo/ / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang 'thob bo/ / de ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad dang dge ba'i rtsa ba lhan cig tu gyur pa ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su bslab pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas gnyis su med par smra ba yin no/ /

“What is the great enlightening beings’ practice of truth? Here the enlightening beings perfect true speech—they can act in accord with what they say, and can speak according to what they do.
